articles.title: Sender of letters praising north arrested
Japanese reactionaries' moves for overseas aggression
articles.content:
Sender of letters praising north arrested
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- As reported, letters expressing deep reverence for General Secretary  Kim Jong Il and praising the North Korea were recently mailed to "government" organs, schools at all levels and dwelling houses in Taejon, South Korea.   After the investigation, the South Korean authorities arrested Pak Sung Dae, an inhabitant in Yuson district, Taejon, on May 20 on the suspicion of mailing letters by invoking the "National Security Law."    People were stirred up by the letters containing the slogans "Long live the great leader comrade Kim Jong Il " and "Let us get the 'National Security Law' abolished and reunify the country".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's work published in Germany
Stop to suppression of overseas compatriots urged
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's work published in Germany
   Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Wilhelm Pieck press information bureau of the central committee of the Communist Party of Germamy published General Secretary  Kim Jong Il's immortal work "Respecting the Forerunners of the Revolution Is a Noble Moral Obligation of Revolutionaries" in booklet on May 17.
   The pamphlet said in an article of the editorial board that the work is of great significance in the communist movement.
   It was distributed to the communists as a must book.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities' arms buildup denounced
articles.content:
Stop to suppression of overseas compatriots urged
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) --The South Korean Youth League in Japan (Hanchongdong) issued a statement on May 15 condemning the South Korean rulers for barring a Hanchongdong delegation from visiting South Korea to participate in commemorations of the 19th anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising.   
   The statement strongly protested against this action, recalling that the Hanchongdong delegation  was invited to South Korea by the National Alliance for Democracy and Reunification and other organisations of South Korea. 
   The statement demanded the Kim Dae Jung "government"  discontinue the sustained policy of suppressing compatriots overseas and restore the reputation of democratic organisations and personages overseas including the Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification (Hanthongryon) and Hanchongdong.
